subject: Announce: COMUnit 1.1 - a unit testing framework for testing COM Components
msgSnippet: ANNOUNCE: COMUnit 1.1 is now available for download at http://comunit.sourceforge.net COMUnit is a Visual Basic port of the JUnit unit testing framework that
messageBody:
ANNOUNCE: COMUnit 1.1 is now available for download at
http://comunit.sourceforge.net

COMUnit is a Visual Basic port of the JUnit unit testing framework that
is designed to facilitate developing unit tests for Microsoft COM
components. COMUnit 1.1 is a production/stable version that has been
and is actively being used for unit testing enterprise C++ and VB COM
components. COMUnit has already been used in a number of Extreme
Programming projects and is well-suited to Test first design.

New in Version 1.1:
- includes and installs Visual Studio templates making it quick and
simple to create new COMUnit test projects, UnitRunner forms or
TestContainer classes.
- includes the COMUnit Trace ActiveX control allowing easy tracing
within COMUnit tests. This is especially helpful for tracing the
progress of long acceptance tests that may have many asserts.
- includes an installation program making it simple to register COMUnit
components and install the Visual Studio templates.

Features:
- test the public methods of any COM component interface that implements
IUnknown
- develop unit tests in any language that supports COM interfaces
- all unit test code can be maintained in a single Visual Studio
project. No need to build an extra DLL to hold test code.
- no need to build explicit TestSuites. Tests can be selected from the
TestRunner user interface.
- the framework is simple to learn consisting of only 3 interfaces and 5
classes.
- all code is available as open source under the GNU Lesser General
Public License (LGPL)
- test runners are available as ActiveX controls that can be easily
extended and can be modularly added to test forms
- well suited to XP Test first Design.

any questions, comments or suggestions, feel free to send me an email or
post a message on the COMUnit user's mailing list
(mailto:comunit-users@...)
cheers,
owen.
